articles.title: DPRK to launch Its Satellite Soon
articles.content:
DPRK to launch Its Satellite Soon
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Preparations for launching "Kwangmyongsong-2," an experimental communications satellite, by carrier rocket "Unha-2" have been completed at the satellite launching ground in the east coastal area of the DPRK, according to the information available from the Korean Committee of Space Technology.
					 The satellite will be launched soon.
					
					 There is no change in the technological indexes necessary for the safe navigation of airliners and ships provided to the international organizations and the countries concerned in advance.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Gives Field Guidance to Renovated Pyongyang Grand Theatre
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Gives Field Guidance to Renovated Pyongyang Grand Theatre
Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il provided field guidance to the renovated Pyongyang Grand Theatre.
					 He was greeted on the spot by the commanding officers of the Korean People's Army involved in the renovation project and leading officials of the theatre.
					
					The theatre where architecture has been successfully put on a plastic and artistic basis is provided with all facilities for art creation, performing activities and audiences ranging from more than 1,300 seats, stage, ultra-modern sound and lighting equipment, training and makeup rooms to catering facilities.
					
					 He looked round the outside and inside of the theatre for a long while to learn in detail about its renovation.
					
					 Commanding a bird's-eye view of the theatre which looks magnificent and splendid, he recollected with deep emotion the unforgettable historic days. He said that the theatre is, indeed, a significant place which bears witness to major events that took place in the glorious course of the development of the WPK and the DPRK.
					
					 After learning in detail not only about the architectural style and contents of the theatre but its decoration, fixtures and echo inside it, he expressed great satisfaction over the fact that the soldier-builders have renovated the theatre associated with the leadership exploits of President Kim Il Sung on the highest level to meet the aesthetic need of the new century by displaying popular heroism.
					
					 The renovated theatre not only has good inner structure but the renovation has been done on a high level and it is perfect both in contents and style as a palace of culture and arts, he said, extending high appreciation and thanks to the soldier-builders for having successfully renovated the theatre as a modern one.
					
					 The Pyongyang Grand Theatre is an excellent cultural palace in the era of Songun where the national classic beauty is combined with the contemporary beauty and its elegancy, magnificence and exquisiteness are kept in good harmony, he noted, expressing immense joy at being able to bequeath another precious treasure to posterity.
					
					 The theatre is the fruition of the great loving care of the President as it is the embodiment of his ideal of "Believing in people as in Heaven," he said, adding: It is our sacred duty and noble sense of obligation to make this precious legacy bequeathed to us by the President shine generation after generation.
					
					 He set forth tasks to be fulfilled to manage and operate the theatre.
					
					 He was accompanied by Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the C.C., the WPK, Jang Song Thaek and Choe Ik Gyu, department directors of the C.C. the WPK, Kang Nung Su, minister of Culture, and KPA Generals Hyon Chol Hae and Ri Myong Su.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Syrian Minister of Information
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Syrian Minister of Information
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by Mohsen Bilal, minister of Information of Syria.
					 The minister of Information handed the gift over to the head of the delegation of the DPRK Information Committee on a visit to Syria on March 29.

articles.title: Congratulations to Malaysian Prime Minister
articles.content:
Congratulations to Malaysian Prime Minister
Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Premier Kim Yong Il on Saturday sent a congratulatory message to Datuk Sri Mohammad Najib Bin Tun Haji Abudul Razak upon the assumption of his office as Prime Minister of Malaysia.
					 The message expressed the belief that the good relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms in the future, too, and wished him success in his work for the stability and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Officials and Members of KDWU Plant Trees
articles.content:
Officials and Members of KDWU Plant Trees
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Officials and members of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea from different parts of the country planted trees in the Arboretum of the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on April 3 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					They have made sincere efforts to make all species of flowers bloom in the area of the sacred temple of Juche and the area around it look green in all seasons. This time they went there bringing with them at least 100,000 trees of more than 30 good species, at least 2.4 million flower-roots of more than 10 species and lots of gardening implements and cobblestones.
					
					 They planted them there with good great care.

articles.title: Commemorative Stamps Issued
articles.content:
Commemorative Stamps Issued
Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Commemorative stamps (4 kinds of individual stamps) were issued in the DPRK on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
					Printed on the stamps are the gifts presented to President Kim Il Sung by foreign figures and organizations -- a copperplate print "Eight Heads of Steeds", a hunting gun, a bear fur and a fish fossil.

articles.title: Posters Produced
articles.content:
Posters Produced
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Posters were produced on the threshold of the 26th April Spring Friendship Art Festival to be held on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
					 Among them are a poster depicting the fireworks displayed in the sky in April with the immortal flowers Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia and the mark of the festival printed in its centre in relief and another poster carrying the slogan "Let Us Loudly Sing the Songs of Independence, Peace and Friendship!" and portraying foreign artistes in national dresses.
					
					 There are also a poster depicting a vocalist singing to the accompaniment of a piano, a poster showing musicians playing musical instruments under a conductor, a poster representing dancers on the stage and a poster showing acrobats staging acrobatic numbers requiring high technique.

articles.title: Beautiful Moran Hill in Spring
articles.content:
Beautiful Moran Hill in Spring
Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Moran Hill in Pyongyang is covered with flowers of apricot, peach, Rhododendron yedoense, Paenia suffruticosa, royal azalea and peony following golden-bell and azalea these days when the spring has fairly set in.
					 It looks like a blue silk cloth embroidered with colorful flowers.
					
					 Moran Hill covered with thick trees and crystal-clear River Taedong meandering round the steep Chongryu Cliff--these present a picturesque Paenia suffruticosa blossom.
					
					 Hundreds of thousands of trees of more than 200 species grow on the hill and tens of kinds of birds fly in and out there according to seasons. Animals including roe deer, deer, squirrel and others inhabit the hill.
					
					 There are in and around the hill Kim Il Sung Stadium, Arch of Triumph, Moranbong Theater and Kaeson Youth Park, folk-game places such as a swinging site and a ssirum (Korean wrestling) ground, catering facilities, pavilions, lotus ponds and fountains which are blended well with each other.
					
					 The hill has many historical relics, including Chongryu Pavilion, Choesung Pavilion, Chilsong Gate and Hyonmu Gate associated with legends.
					
					 The Ulmil Pavilion in spring where people used to enjoy spring scenery from olden times and the beautiful night view of Pubyok Pavilion where people used to welcome the full moon are among the eight scenic wonders in Pyongyang.
					
					 These days the hill is crowded with working people who enjoy their holidays.

articles.title: Mangyongdae Draws Endless Stream of Visitors
articles.content:
Mangyongdae Draws Endless Stream of Visitors
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung's birthplace at Mangyongdae and the Mangyongdae Revolutionary Museum are visited by an endless stream of servicepersons of the Korean People's Army, people from all walks of life, school youth and children, overseas Koreans and south Koreans and foreign friends on the occasion of the anniversary of his birth. 
					 A total of at least 122 million people have visited Mangyongdae since Kim Il Sung made a triumphant return home. 
					
					 An increasing number of people had visited Mangyongdae since July, Juche 83(1994), bringing the number of visitors to more than 30 million. The annual number of visitors to it reached more than 2 million over the last 15 years whereas their number averaged 1.8 million in the preceding period.
					
					Nearly 204,000 compatriots of at least 13,900 organizations from abroad and south Korea have visited Mangyongdae.
					
					At least 773,000 foreigners of at least 72,200 organizations have visited it. Among them were heads of political parties and state, prominent figures, participants in the Kimilsungia festivals and April Spring Friendship Art Festivals and members of delegations from different countries.

articles.title: Brilliant Fruition of Indomitable Spirit
articles.content:
Brilliant Fruition of Indomitable Spirit
Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Working people of Kangwon Province have successfully completed the giant construction of a hydro-power station with their own efforts and technology and increased electricity production, with the result that they realized the electrification of the dwelling houses in Wonsan City on a high level.
					When General Secretary Kim Jong Il visited the newly built Wonsan Youth Power Station in early January this year, he said that the people of Kangwon Province created a thing out of nothing and this proud success represented the victory of the great mental power of the Korean people to build a great, prosperous and powerful socialist nation without fail by dint of their own strength, technology and resources.
					
					 Many miracles have been wrought in the DPRK by an indomitable spirit of the Korean people who are vigorously dashing forward toward an eminence of the times in their own way with a firm belief in their strength, turning impossibility into possibility and the unfavorable circumstances into favorable ones.
					
					 Lots of power stations, big and small, have been constructed across the country, which have protected the lives and property of the people and increased the power output. At the same time, they have made a great contribution to the economic development of the nation and changed the looks of the territory. 
					
					 Thanks to the dynamic land re-zoning projects, hundreds of thousands of hectares of paddy and non-paddy fields have been readjusted to suit socialist Korea and the Kaechon-Lake Thaesong Waterway and the Paekma-Cholsan Waterway, large-scale gravity-fed irrigation system, have been completed, demonstrating their great vitality.
					
					 The people in the east coastal areas, who had been supplied with the salt produced in the west coastal areas in the past, have built the Kwangmyongsong Saltern and the Wonsan Bay Saltern with their efforts, contributing to the development of the nation's chemical industry and local industry and improving the people's living.
					
					 Many cities and counties including Samjiyon County of Ryanggang Province, Hoeryong City of North Hamgyong Province, Manpho City of Jagang Province and Ryongchon County of North Phyongan Province were wonderfully facelifted and rural villages including Poman-ri of Sohung County and Migok-ri of Sariwon City, North Hwanghae Province, were turned into the paradises of the Workers' Party era and the socialist fairylands.
					
					 Now the Korean people are striving hard with a firm determination to open the gate to a thriving nation by 2012, the centenary of President Kim Il Sung's birth, by giving fullest play to the indomitable mental power and mobilizing all the potentialities made under the banner of Songun.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group' Action to Reduce Staff of Human Rights Organization Flayed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group' Action to Reduce Staff of Human Rights Organization Flayed
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- The women and media persons' human rights organizations of south Korea including the Federation of Women's Organization and the Joint Conference of Human Rights Organizations held a joint press conference in Seoul on April 1 at which they denounced the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors for their action to reduce the staff of human rights organization. 
					 The organizations in a press release made public at the conference accused Lee of seeking to put the "human rights committee" under his direct control, regarding it as a thorn in his flesh from the first day of his office. The Lee "government's" action to cut down the staff of the "human rights committee" is aimed to pursue its unilateral policy, the organizations charged. 
					
					  The press release urged the "government" to stop at once the above-said action.

articles.title: DPRK's Significant Day Celebrated in Guinea
articles.content:
DPRK's Significant Day Celebrated in Guinea
Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- A lecture meeting and a reading session took place in Guinea on March 26 and 27 on the occasion of the 16th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission.
					 Riyad Chaloub, chief of the Guinean Group for the Study of February 16 Art, said in the lecture that socialist Korea has won victories one after another, braving all difficulties of history and the credit for it goes to Kim Jong Il who is devoting his all to prosperity of the country and happiness of the people.
					
					 Kim Jong Il has been dedicating himself to defending the dignity of the country and the national sovereignty and providing happiness of the people and prosperity of the country, he said, adding: Great changes are now taking place in the life of the Korean people thanks to his tirelessly devoted efforts.
					
					  Camano Vitor, chairman of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Conakry, Guinea, said at the reading session that the main feature in the mode of Kim Jong Il's leadership is to solve all problems by dint of ideology while giving priority to it.
					
					Kim Jong Il kindled the torch of a new great revolutionary surge to bring about a great leap in all fields by giving full play to the mental power and potentials of the people so as to open the gate to a great prosperous and powerful nation in 2012 marking the centenary of birth of President
						Kim Il Sung, he noted, saying: The inexhaustible mental power will surely bring about the amazing reality in which the cause of building a thriving nation is accomplished, in the near future.

articles.title: RPDC lanzara pronto satelite artificial, informa ATCC
articles.content:
RPDC lanzara pronto satelite artificial, informa ATCC
 Pyongyang, 4 de abril (ATCC) -- Segun la informacion del Comite de Tecnologias Espaciales de Corea, fueron ultimados los preparativos para lanzar el satelite piloto de comunicaciones "Kwangmyongsong-No.2" a bordo del cohete transportador "Unha-2" en el Campo de Lanzamiento de Satelite Artificial Tonghae de nuestro pais.
					 El satelite sera lanzado pronto.
					
					 No hay cambios en los indices tecnicos notificados previamente a las correspondientes organizaciones internacionales y los paises interesados para la segura navegacion de aviones y embarcaciones.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe regalo del ministro de Informacion de Siria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe regalo del ministro de Informacion de Siria
Pyongyang, 4 de abril (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibio regalo que le dirigiera el ministro de Informacion de Siria, Mohsen Bilal.
					  El ministro sirio lo entrego el 29 de marzo al jefe de la delegacion del Comite de Informacion de Corea, de visita en Siria.

articles.title: Gremiales de UMDC plantan arboles en arboleda de palacio memorial
articles.content:
Gremiales de UMDC plantan arboles en arboleda de palacio memorial
Pyongyang, 4 de abril (ATCC) -- Con motivo del Dia del Sol (15 de abril, dia de nacimiento del Presidente Kim Il Sung), las funcionarias y gremiales de la Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea plantaron el dia 3 arboles en la arboleda del Palacio Memorial Kumsusan.
					 Ellas plantaron en esta ocasion mas de 100 mil  arboles de mas de 30 generos de rapido crecimiento, mas de 2 millones 400 mil raices florales de mas de 10 generos y donaron muchos instrumentos de administracion y guijas de adorno.
					
					 Prosiguen desde mucho antes sus ingentes y devotos esfuerzos por cubrir ese sagrado lugar supremo del Juche de flores de toda clase y arboles siempre frondosos.

articles.title: Guinea: conferencia y cenaculo de lectura por efemeride coreana
articles.content:
Guinea: conferencia y cenaculo de lectura por efemeride coreana
Pyongyang, 4 de abril (ATCC) -- Con motivo del 16o aniversario de la eleccion del Dirigente
					Kim Jong Il como Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, tuvieron lugar los dias 26 y 27 de marzo la conferencia y el cenaculo de lectura en Guinea.
					  El jefe del Grupo de Estudio del Arte 16 de Febrero" de Guinea, Riyad Chaloub, dijo en la conferencia que en la base de la Corea socialista, que avanza siempre victoriosa superando todos los vientos y mareas de la historia, estan las huellas de abnegacion del Dirigente Kim Jong Il quien dedica todo lo suyo para la prosperidad del pais y la felicidad del pueblo.
					
					  Prosiguio que el Dirigente Kim Jong Il trabaja con gran abnegacion para defender la dignidad del pais y la soberania nacional, la felicidad del pueblo y la prosperidad de la patria y agrego que gracias a su larga trayectoria de abnegacion, se registran hoy grandes cambios en la vida del pueblo coreano.
					
					El presidente del Grupo de Estudio de la Idea Juche en Conakry, Guinea, Camano Vitor, dijo en el cenaculo de lectura que la importante caracteristica del modo de direccion de Su Excelencia
						Kim Jong Il es resolver todos los asuntos con el poderio de la idea.
					
					  Prosiguio que Su Excelencia Kim Jong Il encendio la antorcha del nuevo y gran auge revolucionario para dar pasos agigantados en todos los sectores al emplear al maximo el poderio espiritual y las potencialidades del pueblo bajo la meta de abrir las puertas a la gran potencia prospera en el ano 2012, en que se cumple el centenario de natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					
					  Subrayo que la inagotable potencia espiritual del pueblo coreano traera sin falta en unos anos cercanos la admirable realidad: cumplimiento de la causa de construccion de una gran potencia prospera.
